newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Sinochem HK (Holdings) completes US$50 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Sinochem HK (Holdings) completes US$50 mln loan.

text.p: Sinochem Hong Kong (Holdings) Co Ltd's US$50 million term loan facility has been closed, arranger Sumitomo Bank said on Thursday.
Sinochem Hong Kong is a wholly-owned subsidiary of China National Chemicals Import & Export Corp.
The three-year loan, guaranteed by its parent, pays a margin of 50 basis points over the London Interbank Offered Rate.
Proceeds will be used for general working capital.
Ten international banks, in addition to the arranger, joined the syndication.
Arranger Sumitomo Bank committed to US$6 million.
Co-arrangers, with US$5.5 million each, are DG Bank, Gulf International Bank, Mitsubishi Trust and Banking Corp, Sakura Bank, Tokai Bank and Toyo Trust & Banking Co.

Lead managers are CARIPLO's Hongkong branch, with US$3.5 million, and Banco Exterior de Espana's Hongkong branch, Development Bank of Singapore's Shanghai branch and Kredietbank, with US$2.5 million each.
